abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the project is
            satisfactory, and sustainability is likely. The performance
            of the Bank was satisfactory, with full collaboration with
            the Borrower, whose performance was very satisfactory, for,
            measures were taken to encourage local government authority,
            and decrease reliance on the national budget. Key lessons
            include: 1) multi-sector projects, involving various
            implementing agencies, will succeed through institutional
            support mechanisms, particularly in the absence of adequate
            monitoring by the lead Ministry, as in this case, whose
            success was, largely due to the supporting infrastructure
            within the implementing unit; 2) the success of the housing
            finance system is due to strong leadership, who ensured that
            housing, titling and financing were in accordance with the
            design - adapted to local conditions, management, loan
            mechanisms, and foreclosure laws; 3) while large civil
            contracts succeed, partly, if considerable time and effort
            is devoted to negotiating claims by the contractors, the
            services of claim specialists, may facilitate the stress on
            performance, substantially; 4) strengthening municipal
            capacity was key to project sustainability; however,
            capacity building may be affected if transfer of trained
            staff is constant; 5) co-financing should be identified at
            project preparation to ensure timely loan effectiveness;
            and, 6) the need exists for a development framework,
            particularly a strategy for fiscal decentralization.
